content.description: This is a mellow climb following great holds up the dihedral.
content.protection: A standard rack or a toprope.
content.location: It is dead center in the middle of Marina Ridge.

content.description: Sandbar has face climbing on positive features through several horizontal breaks (small-medium cams) and finishes on an overhanging move up high.
Runabout is a great warm-up for the area. There are left and right variations to this line. The left begins using a hueco on a blunt arete, and the right begins in an obvious crack feature.
content.location: Ascend the middle of the wall to the left of the dogleg crack.

content.description:
This route starts on the cool featured arete left of

Cutter

. Pull the low roof on jugs, continue up the face on runout but easy terrain, and finish on the final headwall.
content.protection: Small-medium gear and a tree anchor at the top.

content.description: The hardest project of the area, this route has a bouldery start, an easy middle, and a show-stopper, overhanging crux section.
content.protection: It is toprope protected only as of now.
content.location: This ascends the huge roof on the left.

content.description: Start low in the overhang on underclings, ascend the wall staying to the arete feature first, and then transition to the crack.
content.location: Start on the overhanging section to the right.

content.description:
This is probably the best route in the area.

Several variations begin this route, but for the full value, begin on the short slab to the left in a small cave-like feature—stem up and right to make a cool move around the corner. Scramble up easy terrain until you reach the overhanging crack feature. Figure out the roof sequence, and hike the last moves to the top.
content.protection: A toprope or a standard rack.
content.location: Begin in a dihedral under a small roof on the left end of the formation.

content.description: Climb the low-angle yet technical arete. Pull over the small roof at the top.
content.location: This ascends the arete to the right of ?Skiff?.

content.description: The route stays directly on a blunt arete and pulls a small, roof-like outcropping at the top. This is more technical than it looks from the ground but still very mellow.
content.location:
It is 10 feet to the right of the

Skiff

.
